paper.title: Determinants of bid-ask spread in emerging sovereign bond markets
paper.abstract: Major emerging market countries issue significant amounts of local currency bonds in order to finance their budget deficits. As liquidity is a substantial feature of the financial markets, understanding bond liquidity dynamics is essential. The bid-ask spread is an important measure of bond liquidity and reflects explicit transaction costs. We apply a panel regression model in order to analyze bond-level and country-level characteristics' effects on bond liquidity and bid-ask spread. Results show that volatility, credit risk and duration have significant effects on emerging market bond liquidity. Emerging market sovereign bonds with lower volatility, lower credit risk and shorter duration have narrower bid-ask spreads, on average.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究新兴市场主权债券的买卖价差及其影响因素，虽然涉及债券流动性和交易成本，但并未直接涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等特定金融领域。
